intro: Aciotis amazonica var. radicans, commonly known as the spreading aciotis, is a flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It is characterized by its trailing growth habit and produces small, yellowish flowers. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves that help it retain moisture in humid conditions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
